steps.description: Set up a Python development environment with necessary libraries and tools.
Implement the basic structure for the chess game including board setup and initial piece placement using ASCII Unicode characters.
Develop the functionality for two-player support, allowing players to input moves using the same keyboard.
Code the move validation logic to interpret 'A2B3' format commands and update the game state accordingly.
Implement memory optimization techniques for efficient game state storage.
Create unit tests for move validation, game state updates, and player interactions.
Implement automated tests to verify the overall game functionality and memory usage.
Set up a version control system, like Git, for managing code changes and collaborative development.
Document the codebase including setup instructions, game rules, and development notes.
Prepare a user guide for end-users on how to play the game, including command instructions and gameplay rules.
